p: Both density plots showed remarkable differences in the size of the bioclimatic niche between G. bermejoi and its two parental species. This can be seen readily when comparing the bioclimatic niches of G. bermejoi and G. struthium subsp. struthium ( Fig 6A), particularly those concerning the area and the centroid projected from the environmental hyperspace. In the case of G. struthium subsp. struthium, this projected area was more than double that for G. bermejoi. In other words, the set of suitable combinations of bioclimatic variables was much smaller for G. bermejoi than for G. struthium subsp. struthium. There were also noticeable differences between the bioclimatic niches in the PCA plot of G. bermejoi and G. tomentosa ( Fig 6B), albeit not as important as those shown for G. struthium subsp. struthium. In this case the projected areas were more closely matched and the centroids were closer, suggesting that the bioclimatic niches for G. bermejoi and G. tomentosa were generally more similar.
